data.title: Awesome Pizza
data.text: Some of the best pizza we've ever had. The crust is the best. Never had bad pizza or service. The beer selection is nice too.

data.title: Pizza! Pizza!
data.text: Wow!! Never had better pizza! The crust is always fresh and yummy. Can't say enough great things about it.

data.title: Deliciously Different
data.text: The pizza crust is light and the sauce has a slightly sweet taste. Simply delicious! The Brier Hill is our favorite, but you've got to try all the interesting combos to find your fave.

data.title: Not all that impressed
data.text: Setup is that you order at the counter and your food is brought out in disposable plates. Mistakenly thought this was more of a restaurant. There are 2 separate but connected sides. One side is a large bar, the other side has tables and chairs. Not much of a decor, more of a downtown , urban bar. They have pizza, soups, salads, paninis, sweet treats and 'Signature Foods- hot peppers, fried cheese, meatballs, shrimp, pasta ,  '  Had an unimpressive meatball bowl 4.99 - Three meatballs and a sliver of pizza bread. Slices of pizza are on a warming tray, and you can order 'what they have left'. Maybe pizza  would be OK for takeout when made to order. Unimpressive interior for dining in.

data.title: Tasty and filling
data.text: We stopped here after a visit to the OH WOW! children's museum and had a great spinach pizza. The kiddies even ate the edges! Service was prompt and very friendly. We enjoyed the artwork and sugary donut-like balls while waiting for our pizza to bake.

data.title: fantastic pizza downtown!
data.text: Recently popped in here after a little walking tour to see the renovations going on in my hometown. This little hole-in-the-wall shoudl not be missed! The service was very friendly, and I can say the italian sausage pizza was the best I have ever had! Great value and a great pizza.

data.title: Nostalgic Pizza!
data.text: My husband and I visited the restaurant to catch a quick bite on my work break. We were the only ones dining in, but there was a steady stream of take-out orders being picked up. The staff was very courteous and our order of a 14 inch pizza was made within 20 minutes. The restaurant itself seems like it is still under a bit of construction as there is a bar on the other side of the dining area which looked undone. There is a beautiful mural on the wall with contemporary light fixtures; quite eclectic. Our pizza was DELICIOUS and reminiscent of what pizza used to taste like when I was a child. You can tell that everything was homemade. You could taste the yeast in the dough, which was light and crispy. The sauce tasted like it had been simmering on the stove. The cheese was very authentic; aged to perfection, buttery, and chewy. The best pizza I have tasted by far in Youngstown and I have lived here my entire life! There are other things on the menu such as soups, salads, and desserts. Prices are comparable to other local establishments. Another best kept secret of Downtown Youngstown. I would definitely dine here again.
